title: 108_hr3495
content: Section 629 of the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act is amended to establish an Emergency Preparedness Demonstration Program to assist disadvantaged communities. The Director will establish an emergency preparedness demonstration program to support disadvantaged communities in conducting programs for data, information, and awareness education through grants or contracts with eligible nonprofit organizations. Activities include researching emergency preparedness status in households of disadvantaged individuals and promoting awareness education programs within these communities. The program supports disadvantaged communities by providing education and awareness materials through grants to eligible nonprofit organizations. Organizations must be nonprofit, serve disadvantaged communities, and partner with disadvantaged businesses. Funds can only be used for expert professional services for research in disadvantaged communities. The cooperative agreement awarded under this section allows the use of funds for acquiring professional services, developing informational materials for promoting emergency preparedness in disadvantaged communities, establishing consortia with national organizations, and implementing joint projects with institutions serving disadvantaged individuals. The section outlines eligibility criteria for organizations, including part B institutions, institutions described in specific sections of the Higher Education Act, and Hispanic-serving institutions. To receive funding, organizations must submit an application with required information. Definitions include disadvantaged business enterprise and disadvantaged community. The curr_chunk defines key terms related to disadvantaged individuals and communities, including disadvantaged business enterprise, disadvantaged community, disadvantaged individual, and HUBZone. It also authorizes appropriations for fiscal years 2004 through 2007.
